org.gbif.crawler.client

Class HttpCrawlClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.crawler.client.HttpCrawlClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CrawlClient<String,org.apache.http.HttpResponse>

    @ThreadSafe
public class HttpCrawlClient
extends Object
implements CrawlClient<String,org.apache.http.HttpResponse>
    Executes HTTP GET requests in String form using Apache HttpClient.

    This client does not support HTTPS.

    ResponseHandlers must understand how to process a HttpResponse but they do not need to handle stream closing as this is done by this class. When not needed anymore shutdown() should be called so underlying resources (e.g. the connection manager) can be closed.

    This class is thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static HttpCrawlClient newInstance(int connectionTimeout,
                          int maxTotalConnections,
                          int maxTotalPerRoute)
        Factory method to create a new instance of this client with a few default settings. This creates an instance that works with HTTP only (no HTTPS), uses multi-threading for its connections, supports compressed content and sets some user provided timeouts.
        Parameters:
        connectionTimeout - this timeout in milliseconds is used for establishing a connection and for waiting for data
        maxTotalConnections - maximum total number of connections
        maxTotalPerRoute - maximum number of connections per host
        Returns:
        new HttpCrawlClient with default settings

      • execute

        public <RESULT> RESULT execute(String request,
                      ResponseHandler<org.apache.http.HttpResponse,RESULT> handler)
               throws FatalCrawlException,
                      TransportException,
                      ProtocolException
        Initiates the request using HTTP and processes the response with the given Response handler.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface CrawlClient<String,org.apache.http.HttpResponse>
        Parameters:
        request - that should be issued
        handler - to process the response and that produces the result
        Throws:
        TransportException - on transport error, such as timeout, unable to connect etc.
        ProtocolException - on error during handling of the response (e.g. such as a unexpected format, XML issues)
        FatalCrawlException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Should be called when this object is not needed anymore so that resources can be closed.
